results.title: The Federal Republic of Germany and the Federal Lands
results.brief_description: A study of the Federal system of the German Republic (West Germany). Shows the responsibilities of the Government in Bonn as well as the governments of the ten states (Laender) which comprise the German Federation.

results.title: The Feathers of peace [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: He Taonga Films, Ruth Panapa and Barry Barclay
results.brief_description: Written and directed by Barry Barclay, “Feathers of peace” documents the destruction, by both Maori and European invaders, of the Moriori people, the original inhabitants of the Chatham Islands which lie 870 km east of mainland New Zealand. The tragic history unfolds in 4 sections using black and white reconstructed ‘archival’ footage of poor visual and aural quality, interviews, drawings, stills and musical interludes with voice overs. Employing an innovative and sometimes confusing style, the documentary follows the decline of the peaceful Moriori from the initial minor cultural misunderstandings that take place when the first English ship arrives, to their full-scale enslavement and massacre by the Maori.

results.title: The Feast
results.creator_credit: Documentary Educational Resources and Timothy Asch
results.brief_description: Illustrates the feasting practices of the Yanomamo Indians of southern Venezuela, at the headwaters of the Orinoco River. These feasts provide an opportunity for the forming of alliances between independent sovereign villages. Based on Chapter IV of Napoleon Chagnon’s ethnographic work, Yanomano: the fierce people.

results.title: The FBI
results.creator_credit: Quinn Martin, Warner Bros Pictures, Seven Arts, Charles Larson and George McCowan
results.brief_description: This television series screened between 1965 and 1975. Its production was endorsed by the Federal Bureau of Investigation with episodes based on actual FBI case files. Its emotionless portrayal of agents tracking down criminals provides a cool and compelling atmosphere. This episode called “Southwind” sees a banker escaping on a plane with two million dollars. Not only has he stolen money he has left gambling debts and a man injured in hospital. With no leads it is left to the methodical actions of the FBI agents to find the missing banker. This is a series where politics and drama meet as each episode was allegedly approved by J. Edgar Hoover himself. Cast includes Efrem Zimblist Jr., Philip Abbot and William Reynolds.

results.title: The Fauves
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Education Dept. Audio-Visual Resources Branch and Ross Campbell
results.brief_description: The Fauves were a group of artists centred around Henri Matisse, who worked together for a period of two years. The style was a mixture of technique with features derived from Sevrat, Van Gogh and later, Gauguin. The Fauves proclaimed the value of the formal elements in a painting. Their ideas greatly influenced the course of twentieth century art intended to be a stimulating resource material for senior art students. Music by Claude Debussy, Alexander Scriabin and Alan Hovhaness.

results.title: The Fate of Lee Khan [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: King Hu Film Productions, Golden Harvest and King Hu
results.brief_description: A martial arts historical epic of deceit, vengeance, treachery and bloody retribution. In 1366 Yuan dynasty China is ruled by Mongol invaders. Lee Khan, a ruthless, decadent aristocrat and master swordsman, and his beautiful but heartless sister, attempt defend their corrupt legacy of privilege and power. They face defeat when group of Chinese national revolutionaries organize and wage a great uprising against their Mongolian oppressors. Cast includes Angela Mao, Hsu Feng, Roy Chiao. In Cantonese with English subtitles.

results.title: The Fatal glass of beer
results.creator_credit: Mack Sennett Comedies, Mack Sennett and Clyde Bruckman
results.brief_description: This film is about a prodigal son returning to a snowbound cabin in the Yukon. Described as an absurd star comedy with appeal to addicts only: most of the humour consists of repeats of one line, “Taint a fit night out for man nor beast”. This film was written by W.C. Fields who also starred in it, along with Rosemary Theby, George Chandler and Richard Cramer.

results.title: The Fatal game
results.creator_credit: J A A Films, Orana Films, Richard Dennison and James Heyward
results.brief_description: Australian Mike Rheinberger has made six attempts to reach the top of Mount Everest. His dream of conquering the mountain has become an obsession. On his seventh attempt, he and companion Mark Whetu finally reach the top and soon plunge into nightmare. After the elation of victory comes the realisation that it is too late to walk down to camp before nightfall. At 29,000 feet, they bivouac on a ridge, enduring temperatures of minus 25 degrees Celsius. The pair survives the night in what in called “the death zone” only to be awakened to a situation of extreme urgency. Mark Whetu is left to make a decision that will stay with him forever …

results.title: The Fat film
results.brief_description: This film demonstrates in a humorous manner the social difficulties encountered by an individual undertaking a weight reduction plan. It presents the story of Kate, her resolve to begin a diet, her failure to maintain it, and her resolution to try again. Related issues include peer pressure, the social significance of food, stereotyping, public/media image of the body ideal.

results.title: The Fat film
results.creator_credit: Pyramid Films, Image Associates, Katherine Lisciandro, John Lengsfelder and Frank J. Lisciandro
results.brief_description: Americans have the most fat-filled diet in the world. On an average, over 40% of the calories eaten daily by Americans are fats. A diet high in fat dramatically increases the risk of coronary heart disease, stroke, atherosclerosis, diabetes and cancer. This program outlines constructive nutritional advice for reducing fat content in our diets and thereby improving our health and decreasing our cholesterol level.
